title: Loved ones remember teen killed in Riviera Beach shooting
content:
RIVERIA BEACH, Fla. —
Family members and friends of a 16-year-old boy shot and killed late Friday night in Riviera Beach held a vigil Saturday.
Loved ones brought candles, balloons and stuffed animals to the crime scene.
"You know I got kids, it's like, this is not what I want to raise them in. I mean, a community is supposed to be loved. Where's the love in this? Why?" said friend Fitolay Demesmia.
Johnathan Pearson was found with a gunshot wound to his chest at 11:09 p.m. outside an apartment at 1601 W. 37th St., according to the Riviera Beach Police Department.
Kenerick Taylor, 21, was arrested and charged with second-degree murder.
Taylor initially denied involvement in the shooting, but after questioning, he told investigators the gun accidentally discharged when he was handing it to Pearson, police said.
Taylor pulled Pearson outside of the apartment and remained with him until officers arrived.
A gun was found hidden outside the home.
Angela Williams, the founder of M.A.M.A or Mothers Against Murder Association, is calling for the gun violence to stop.
"Our community is so broken right now. You know there's no trust and we just got to unify ourselves and get a grip of what is going on," said Williams.
Anyone with information about the shooting is asked to call police at 561-845-4123 or Crime Stoppers at 800-458-TIPS.
